image.altText: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr gives his victory speech for the 2024 ACT election.

props.synopsis: ACT Labor has been returned to government after 23 years in power, while two independents will sit in the Legislative Assembly for the first time in more than two decades.

title.children: 'Extraordinary achievement': ACT Labor wins seventh consecutive term in government

image.altText: new crossbench

props.synopsis: For the first time in 20 years, the ACT has elected independent members to parliament. Thomas Emerson and Fiona Carrick have become the first independents elected to the ACT Legislative Assembly since 2001.

title.children: The independent wave hits the ACT as Andrew Barr promises a 'progressive and stable' crossbench

image.altText: Andrew Barr drinks a beer

props.synopsis: The ACT election result is another confirmation of how different Canberra is to the rest of the country, having just voted in a seven-term government, which would almost be impossible in any other jurisdiction.

title.children: If 23 years was considered a 'forever government,' how will we describe it after 27?

image.altText: Antony Green: ACT Labor wins election

props.synopsis: Join us as we bring you live coverage of the 2024 ACT election throughout the evening  — as it happened

title.children: Labor wins a seventh consecutive term in power in the ACT — as it happened

image.altText: Leanne Castley, smiling, in front of a sports ground with The Canberra Hospital in the background.

props.synopsis: On the eve of the election, ACT Labor is found in breach of electoral laws for running advertisements that were "inaccurate and misleading" when criticising the shadow health minister's position on abortion.

title.children: ACT Labor forced to remove 'inaccurate and misleading' election ad

image.altText: An aerial view of Lake Burley Griffin soon after filling up in 1964.

props.synopsis: It's played host to everything from nude swimmers and the Queen of England — not at the same time — to hot air balloons and giant Murray Cod. As Canberra marks 60 years since the inauguration of Lake Burley Griffin, let's take a look at how far it's come.

title.children: It's been 60 years since Lake Burley Griffin was first filled but it wasn't all smooth sailing

image.altText: Ringer holding bottle of water

props.synopsis: Lake Nash Station, one of the oldest cattle runs in the country, was cut off for months by floods in 2023 —but it's bounced back and is now preparing to be flooded by schoolies.

title.children: When schoolies embrace outback life 'everyone leaves a different person'

image.altText: A Air New Zealand plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: It's understood there were 154 passengers and crew on the flight.

title.children: Air New Zealand flight held at Sydney Airport over 'security incident'

image.altText: An elderly man standing behind a picket fence, in front of a house.

props.synopsis: Charlie Salvestro lied about his age to join Australia's largest-ever engineering project. His family's connection to the Snowy Hydro Electric Scheme has been passed down generations.

title.children: From Italy to the Australian alps, Charlie joined the Snowy Hydro 'adventure'

image.altText: Police man with gun walks near car

props.synopsis: It is not clear if the house was hit, but a spokesperson says neither the prime minister nor his wife were home at the time.

title.children: Israel says drone launched towards Benjamin Netanyahu's house

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles

props.synopsis: Experts say that while Donald Trump and the Republican party say IVF treatments in the US are not at risk, signs are pointing otherwise.

title.children: These two events have ignited debate over IVF in the US

image.altText: A woman smiles while holding a microphone

props.synopsis: The ABC has projected independent Jacqui Scruby will win the traditionally blue-ribbon electorate, which was thrust into a by-election after Liberal Rory Anon quit parliament in August after being charged with child-sex offences, which he denies.

title.children: Jacqui Scruby set to become first teal MP in NSW parliament after snatching Pittwater by-election

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with a wide mouth and eyes. The Hard Quiz logo is to his left.

props.synopsis: So you think you could beat a Hard Quiz contestant? Prove it. It's time to play, HARD!

title.children: Like your Sunday coffee with a side of shame? I've got the quiz for you

image.altText: A TV still of Kitty Flanagan sitting at a desk, wearing glasses and a loose brown suit. She has a bemused expression.

props.synopsis: Much-loved comedian Kitty Flanagan talks about the hard road to getting her ABC TV sitcom Fisk made, and how the show has taken off both in Australia and overseas.

title.children: Kitty Flanagan struggled to get Fisk made. Now, the ABC TV show is an international hit

image.altText: Boxer Bakhram Murtazaliev throws his arms out to celebrate beating Australia's Tim Tszyu in their fight.

props.synopsis: Australian Tim Tszyu loses his world title fight with Bakhram Murtazaliev after the Russian knocks him down three times in the second round of their bout in Orlando.

title.children: Tim Tszyu's team throws in the towel after Aussie floored three times in second round

image.altText: Liam Payne photographed in Paris in March 2024.

props.synopsis: Former One Direction singer Zayn Malik says the dates for the US leg of his Stairway to the Sky tour will be rescheduled for January.

title.children: Zayn Malik postpones tour after death of Liam Payne

image.altText: A close up of a child's hands holding a mobile phone, with a game on the screen. In the background is a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: For many people, smartphones are an essential part of life, but in the city of St Albans, some parents have pledged to keep them out of their children's hands until they turn 14.

title.children: This small UK community noticed kids with 'TikTok brain'. Giving them a 'brick phone' could be the solution

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: The Pacific nation's gun amnesty coincided with the shooting death of a 12-year-old child — just one week after the alleged murder of a police officer.

title.children: 'Take my gun, take me with it': Samoa's gun amnesty sees limited success

image.altText: An older woman in a grey knitted jumper and an older man in a green flannelette shirt stands in their Earthship.

props.synopsis: Recent widespread power outages in Tasmania had absolutely no effect on the couple, who generate their own electricity using solar panels, and only use an estimated 2 kWh per day.

title.children: Storms and power outages highlight benefits of living off-grid, as couple kept 'living life as normal'

image.altText: Early voting Queensland

props.synopsis: With so many Queenslanders now opting to vote early, it doesn't make sense for the political parties to wait until the home stretch of the election campaign to unveil their major initiatives.

title.children: Go hard, go early: Big pre-poll voting numbers changing how parties campaign

image.altText: A ruler hitting a hand.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party candidates vow to "bring back the smack" as they campaign on youth crime ahead of the Queensland state election.

title.children: Katter party candidates campaign to bring back corporal punishment for children

image.altText: Three women standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: More than 50 years on, Robyn Cohen still lives with the pain of having had her baby forcibly given up for adoption. She's one of a number of Tasmanian women affected by the practice who are fighting for compensation.

title.children: 'Finally, we have a voice': Victims of forced adoption practices continue push for compensation

image.altText: A man in a green shirt standing next to a box of potatoes

props.synopsis: More than 40 per cent of Gary Kadwell's property is dedicated to revegetation after he planted tens of thousands of trees across his property. It is a move that has seen him save thousands of dollars and improve production levels.

title.children: These farmers are saving tens of thousands of dollars for helping the planet

image.altText: Black and white portrait of bearded Bram Stoker posing in an arm chair

props.synopsis: Gibbet Hill — set in a notorious crime hotspot in the English countryside and published as Bram Stoker was beginning work on Dracula — is rediscovered by an amateur historian passing the time in the National Library of Ireland.

title.children: Amateur historian turns up long-lost story by Dracula author Bram Stoker

image.altText: A man with dark hair and goatee poses in casual clothes

props.synopsis: Dr Zimbardo is remembered for an ill-fated 1971 prison study in which he recruited college-aged males to spend two weeks in a mock prison in the basement of a building on the Stanford campus.

title.children: Stanford Prison Experiment creator Philip G Zimbardo dies

image.altText: a young man in a white t-shirt

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed tiny biological bridges, each made up of millions of nasal cells, which they hope will encourage nerve cells to regenerate and grow over a patient's spinal cord injury.

title.children: Human trial to treat patients paralysed by spinal injury with cells transplanted from their nose

image.altText: Auckland FC fans wave black and blue flags and release blue smoke during an A-League Men game.

props.synopsis: Between Auckland FC's first-up win over Brisbane, and the Sydney derby featuring the debuts of Juan Mata and Douglas Costa, 50,000 fans turn up across two A-League Men games either side of the Tasman.

title.children: A-League sell-outs either side of the ditch as Auckland debuts and stars arrive in Sydney derby

image.altText: Orphaned Brushtail Possum wrapped in a blanket.

props.synopsis: A horror Sunday saw the service field 894 calls for help, prompting requests for increased government support.

title.children: Wildlife Victoria records most calls for assistance in 35-year history

image.altText: A man in a suit with glasses and a suit

props.synopsis: The Coalition's first major housing policy announcement ahead of the election promises $5 billion to fast-track water and roads to speed up the construction of 500,000 new housing developments.

title.children: Dutton's $5 billion plan to speed up construction of outer-suburban housing developments

image.altText: a needle in the sand

props.synopsis: A criminal lawyer in the state's far north says clients with methamphetamine addiction on remand or bail have been left with no treatment options, amid concerns the drug's use  in the region has reached dire proportions.

title.children: Addicts left with 'nowhere' to go amid 'disastrous levels' of methamphetamine use in WA

image.altText: A search and rescue helicopter hovers above a large lake.

props.synopsis: Police have recovered the bodies of a woman and two children from the Georges River in Sydney's south-west, after the trio were seen in distress earlier in the day.

title.children: Woman and two children found dead in river in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: A person walks in the dark on a street.

props.synopsis: Cuba's electrical grid has collapsed for the second time in just hours, according to state-run media, blacking out the entire country.

title.children: Nationwide blackouts hit Cuba

image.altText: A man and two women are standing in a dusty paddock, under a sunny sky. Their hands are out patting the white herd of goats

props.synopsis: When the Jessen family lost their major milk processor, they were able to pivot but they want to see more industry representation across the country.

title.children: Dairy goat farmers confident in future despite lack of industry representation

image.altText: A commonwealth bank sign and logo.

props.synopsis: The bank says the process to reverse these transactions has been completed.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank says duplicate transactions have now been reversed

image.altText: Ciaron Maher and Craig Williams gives the thumbs up after winning The Everest.

props.synopsis: In the space of just over an hour, Ciaron Maher caps off a remarkable day by adding a Caulfield Cup win to a triumph in The Everest, as Bella Nipotina and Duke De Sessa both salute.

title.children: Star trainer Ciaron Maher claims stunning double with victories in The Everest and Caulfield Cup
